net.trajano.wagon.git.internal

Class AbstractGitWagon

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.apache.maven.wagon.AbstractWagon
      • org.apache.maven.wagon.StreamWagon
        • net.trajano.wagon.git.internal.AbstractGitWagon
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    org.apache.maven.wagon.StreamingWagon, org.apache.maven.wagon.Wagon
    Direct Known Subclasses:
    GitHubPagesWagon, GitWagon

    public abstract class AbstractGitWagon
extends org.apache.maven.wagon.StreamWagon
    Common parts of handling Git based repositories.

    • Method Detail

      • buildGitUri

        public abstract GitUri buildGitUri(URI repositoryUrl)
                            throws IOException,
                                   URISyntaxException
        Builds the wagon specific Git URI based on the repository URL. This is made public rather than protected to allow testing of the method.
        Parameters:
        repositoryUrl - repository URL
        Returns:
        Git URI
        Throws:
        IOException
        URISyntaxException

      • closeConnection

        public void closeConnection()
                     throws org.apache.maven.wagon.ConnectionException
        This will commit the local changes and push them to the repository. If the method is unable to push to the repository without force, it will throw an exception.
        Specified by:
        closeConnection in class org.apache.maven.wagon.StreamWagon
        Throws:
        org.apache.maven.wagon.ConnectionException

      • fillInputData

        public void fillInputData(org.apache.maven.wagon.InputData inputData)
                   throws org.apache.maven.wagon.TransferFailedException,
                          org.apache.maven.wagon.ResourceDoesNotExistException,
                          org.apache.maven.wagon.authorization.AuthorizationException
        This will read from the working copy. File modification date would not be available as it does not really have any meaningful value.
        Specified by:
        fillInputData in class org.apache.maven.wagon.StreamWagon
        Throws:
        org.apache.maven.wagon.ResourceDoesNotExistException - when the file does not exist
        org.apache.maven.wagon.authorization.AuthorizationException - when the file cannot be read

      • getFileForResource

        protected abstract File getFileForResource(String resourceName)
                                    throws org.eclipse.jgit.api.errors.GitAPIException,
                                           IOException,
                                           URISyntaxException
        This will get the file object for the given resource relative to the Git specified for the connection. It will handle resources where it jumps up past the parent folder.
        Parameters:
        resourceName - resource name.
        Returns:
        file used for the resource.
        Throws:
        IOException
        org.eclipse.jgit.api.errors.GitAPIException - problem with the GIT API.
        URISyntaxException
        org.apache.maven.wagon.ResourceDoesNotExistException

      • putDirectory

        public void putDirectory(File sourceDirectory,
                         String destinationDirectory)
                  throws org.apache.maven.wagon.TransferFailedException,
                         org.apache.maven.wagon.ResourceDoesNotExistException,
                         org.apache.maven.wagon.authorization.AuthorizationException
        If the destination directory is not inside the source directory (denoted by starting with "../"), then another git repository is registered. Warnings are suppressed for false positive with Sonar and multiple exceptions on public API.
        Specified by:
        putDirectory in interface org.apache.maven.wagon.Wagon
        Overrides:
